intro: Pocillaria, commonly known as the rockrose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. These plants are typically shrubs or subshrubs, characterized by their woody stems and small, often colorful flowers. They are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, particularly in Europe, Asia, and North America. Pocillaria species are known for their ability to thrive in rocky or dry environments, making them resilient to harsh conditions. Their foliage is usually dense and evergreen, contributing to their ornamental value in gardens.
